definition: one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship

sentences.english: She clawed her way to the top of her profession.
sentences.chinese: 她拼死拼活地爬到了她职业的顶峰。

sentences.english: I said these people just busted their ass and got me the best job in the world for life.
sentences.chinese: 我说，这些人拼死拼活让我得到世界上最好的工作。

sentences.english: It is only a hobby, not a life or death struggle.
sentences.chinese: 这只是一项爱好，不需要拼死拼活地努力。

sentences.english: She clawed her way to the top of her career.
sentences.chinese: 她拼死拼活地爬到了她事业的颠峰。

sentences.english: He slaved to get his own house.
sentences.chinese: 他拼死拼活地干活以便买到属于他自己的住房。

definition: to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
painstakingly/with great trouble
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to have difficulty getting by/to struggle (financially etc)
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
in the end/finally/as a result
to endure (years of suffering)
worthwhile (often in rhetorical questions, implying not worthwhile)/also written 犯得上
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to idle/to waste time
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
with great difficulty/very difficult
